path: books/Topology Without Tears/5. Continuous Mappings/5.1 Continuous Mappings/1/(i)

attr.q: Let $`f:(X,\mathcal{T}) \rightarrow (Y, \tau_1)`$ be a constant function. Show that $`f`$ is continuous.
attr.a:
Let $`f(x) = c`$. Any open set $`S \in \tau_1`$ either contains $`c`$ or not.

If $`c \in S`$, then $`f^{-1}(S) = X`$.  
If $`c \notin S`$, then $`f^{-1}(S) = \emptyset`$.  

Hence continuous.
